headline: YF Invest, Disney earnings, Fed commentary: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Thursday, November 13, including: Yahoo Finance's Invest conference kicks off tomorrow, Thursday, November 13, at 8:00 A.M. Tune in for a day filled with high-profile interviews and panel discussions. Earnings results from companies like Disney (DIS) and Applied Materials (AMAT). And, a slew of commentary from Federal Reserve regional central bank presidents. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

content.title: YF Invest, Disney earnings, Fed commentary: What to Watch

Market Domination Overtime host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Thursday, November 13, including:

Earnings results from companies like Disney (DIS) and Applied Materials (AMAT).

And, a slew of commentary from Federal Reserve regional central bank presidents.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Applied Materials forecasts strong quarterly revenue on AI chip demand
summary: U.S.-based Applied Materials, a maker of semiconductor ​manufacturing equipment, forecast upbeat first-quarter revenue ‌on Thursday, signaling that robust demand for tools used to ‌make AI chips is set to overpower a broader industry slowdown. The surge in AI-driven demand for advanced memory chips is spurring heavy investment in new fabrication equipment,⁠ boosting orders ‌for Applied Materials' manufacturing tools. The company forecast current-quarter revenue of $6.85 ‍billion, plus or minus $500 million.

content.title: Applied Materials forecasts strong quarterly revenue on AI chip demand
content.summary: U.S.-based Applied Materials, a maker of semiconductor ​manufacturing equipment, forecast upbeat first-quarter revenue ‌on Thursday, signaling that robust demand for tools used to ‌make AI chips is set to overpower a broader industry slowdown. The surge in AI-driven demand for advanced memory chips is spurring heavy investment in new fabrication equipment,⁠ boosting orders ‌for Applied Materials' manufacturing tools. The company forecast current-quarter revenue of $6.85 ‍billion, plus or minus $500 million.

headline: Applied Materials: Fiscal Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: AMAT) on Thursday reported fiscal fourth-quarter net income of $1.9 billion. The Santa Clara, California-based company said it had net income of $2.38 per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were $2.17 per share.

content.title: Applied Materials: Fiscal Q4 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: AMAT) on Thursday reported fiscal fourth-quarter net income of $1.9 billion. The Santa Clara, California-based company said it had net income of $2.38 per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were $2.17 per share.

headline: Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) Beats Q3 Sales Targets But Inventory Levels Increase
summary: Semiconductor machinery manufacturer Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) reported revenue ahead of Wall Streets expectations in Q3 CY2025, but sales fell by 3.5% year on year to $6.8 billion. Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was better than expected at $6.85 billion at the midpoint, 0.7% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.17 per share was 3.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) Beats Q3 Sales Targets But Inventory Levels Increase

Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was better than expected at $6.85 billion at the midpoint, 0.7% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $2.17 per share was 3.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Applied Materials projects upbeat quarterly revenue on steady AI chip demand
summary: Applied Materials, a semiconductor manufacturing equipment supplier, projected stronger-than-expected first-quarter revenue on Thursday, suggesting ​that demand for tools used in AI chip production may offset weakness ‌in some parts of the industry. The growing need for advanced memory chips used in artificial intelligence applications is ‌driving increased investment in fabrication equipment and fueling orders for Applied Materials' tools "Based on our conversations with our customers and partners, we are preparing Applied' s operations and service organizations to be ready to support higher demand beginning in the second ⁠half of calendar 2026,"‌ said Brice Hill, chief financial officer, a...

The growing need for advanced memory chips used in artificial intelligence applications is ‌driving increased investment in fabrication equipment and fueling orders for Applied Materials' tools "Based on our conversations with our customers and partners, we are preparing Applied' s operations and service organizations to be ready to support higher demand beginning in the second ⁠half of calendar 2026,"‌ said Brice Hill, chief financial officer, a...

headline: Applied Materials Forecasts Higher Sales in Second Half of 2026 on Surge in AI Demand
summary: Customers are planning large increases in production at their chip factories, stoking the need for the company’s equipment, services and solutions, said CEO Gary Dickerson.

content.title: Applied Materials Forecasts Higher Sales in Second Half of 2026 on Surge in AI Demand
content.summary: Customers are planning large increases in production at their chip factories, stoking the need for the company’s equipment, services and solutions, said CEO Gary Dickerson.

headline: Applied Materials sees weaker China spending in 2026 on tighter US curbs
summary: Last month, the company forecast a $600 million hit to fiscal 2026 revenue following the U.S. expansion of export restrictions, which complicates shipments of ⁠certain products and services to China-‌based customers.  The company said about $110 million worth of products affected by an affiliate rule that was later suspended after talks between U.S. ‍President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping were not shipped in the fourth quarter.  "The impact of these restrictions was equivalent to about 10% of the China market in fiscal 2024 and more than double that amount in fiscal 2025," CFO Brice Hill said.

content.title: Applied Materials sees weaker China spending in 2026 on tighter US curbs
content.summary: Last month, the company forecast a $600 million hit to fiscal 2026 revenue following the U.S. expansion of export restrictions, which complicates shipments of ⁠certain products and services to China-‌based customers.  The company said about $110 million worth of products affected by an affiliate rule that was later suspended after talks between U.S. ‍President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping were not shipped in the fourth quarter.  "The impact of these restrictions was equivalent to about 10% of the China market in fiscal 2024 and more than double that amount in fiscal 2025," CFO Brice Hill said.

headline: Applied Materials (AMAT) Earnings Transcript
summary: Applied Materials delivered fiscal fourth quarter results above the midpoint of our guidance to complete another record year.  Applied is in a tremendous position to benefit as AI computing fuels secular growth in semiconductors and wafer fab equipment.  As this is our year-end call, I'll begin with a brief review of our performance in 2025, then I'll provide our latest market outlook, and finally, I'll describe how our inflection-focused innovation strategy enables us to extend our leadership in the most valuable and fastest-growing areas of the market as next-generation technologies ramp in volume production in 2026 and beyond.

content.title: Applied Materials (AMAT) Earnings Transcript
content.summary: Applied Materials delivered fiscal fourth quarter results above the midpoint of our guidance to complete another record year.  Applied is in a tremendous position to benefit as AI computing fuels secular growth in semiconductors and wafer fab equipment.  As this is our year-end call, I'll begin with a brief review of our performance in 2025, then I'll provide our latest market outlook, and finally, I'll describe how our inflection-focused innovation strategy enables us to extend our leadership in the most valuable and fastest-growing areas of the market as next-generation technologies ramp in volume production in 2026 and beyond.

headline: US Stock Market Today: S&P 500 Futures Rise as Shutdown Ends, Rate Jitters Build
summary: The Morning Bull - US Market Morning Update Thursday, Nov, 13 2025 US stock futures are ticking upward this morning, with the S&P 500 set to open about 0.1% higher after a market-moving end to the government shutdown. Congress passed a bill to fully reopen the government following a record 43-day closure, and this sudden return to normal operations has pushed the key interest rate for 10-year Treasuries up to 4.09%. That means borrowing money may now get a bit more expensive for families and...

headline: Applied Materials slips amid warning over China chip spending
summary: Investing.com - Shares of Applied Materials declined by more than 4% in premarket U.S. trading on Friday after the firm warned that spending on chipmaking gear in China is anticipated to fall next year due to more stringent U.S. export controls.

content.title: Applied Materials slips amid warning over China chip spending
content.summary: Investing.com - Shares of Applied Materials declined by more than 4% in premarket U.S. trading on Friday after the firm warned that spending on chipmaking gear in China is anticipated to fall next year due to more stringent U.S. export controls.
